title: In Situ AFM-SEM-EDS, a Correlative Microscopy Platform for Surface Characterization and Elemental Analysis
content: Here, we present a highly integrated correlative microscopy platform (see Fig. 1) which incorporates complementary techniques such as Atomic Force Microscopy (AFM), Scanning Electron Microscopy (SEM), and Energy Dispersive X-ray Spectroscopy (EDS/EDX). In combination with a unified coordinate system, each of these techniques reveals different properties/characteristics of the sample from the same region of interest easily, in contrast to the challenges of ex-situ correlative techniques [1]. This would be very advantageous in fields seeking correlative information, such as the life sciences [2, 3], semiconductor industry [4, 5], earth sciences [6], and pharmaceutical industry [7]. And until now, to our knowledge, no single platform has offered a turnkey in-situ correlative solution of AFM-SEM-EDS with a unified coordinate system for a seamless correlation experience.
